column4: hi. I'm looking for an advice regarding the maintenance period of ubuntu LTS
afaik, desktop is supported for 3 years, while server for 5 years. this is correct?
but, what I'm wondering about, what does that mean in particular?
I mean is there a list of packages classified as server packages
I can start with either desktop or server version and build what I'm after
i don't suggest using a server and building a desktop... i did it once... a lot of things weren't working quite right...
i believe "support" generally means updates, bug fixes etc.
sure, thus the question is what precise list of packages receive 3 years of updates and which one receives 5 years
i suppose anything Ubuntu says they support... anything that's 3rd party is a no go unless backed by a PPA
well if you get 10.04 you should be set until april 2013
just make sure you do "sudo apt-get update" and "sudo apt-get upgrade" before doing anything
also i suggest not doing  that special partitioning thing they got on server, unless you know what you're doing...
no idea, never done LVM... i tend to not use it, as i don't have much experience with it
I actually used it already, but was looking into btrfs and zfs (fuse) as well
ah ok... well i don't use server enough to say anything about that
perfectly fine. just looking for advice. I mean 1500 people in the room may provide 10 experienced people at least ;)
